summary: REQ-2/4/5/6 appear implemented (violet private sidebar styling, contact email update, compare-row removals, and a finance-themed favicon SVG). Cookie consent banner logic exists, but the diff summary doesnâ€™t clearly show it being rendered on all public pages. Quiz dataset expansion to exactly 100 questions cannot be confirmed from truncated content.

missing_requirements.requirement: Expand the quiz question dataset to include 100 meaningful, finance-related quiz questions with all required fields populated.
missing_requirements.reason: `defaultQuizQuestions.ts` content is truncated and only shows the beginning of the array (q1..q8 start). There is no explicit evidence in the provided diff summary that the dataset contains exactly 100 unique questions or that `totalQuestions` will be 100.

missing_requirements.requirement: Show cookie-consent popup on public (non-authenticated) pages until accepted, persist acceptance, and do not show inside authenticated/private pages.
missing_requirements.reason: A `CookieConsent` component exists and is imported in `Header.tsx`, but the `Header.tsx` diff is truncated before showing whether `<CookieConsent />` is actually rendered. Without clear evidence of rendering/integration into public pages, the requirement cannot be fully verified from the diff summary.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/expanded multiple pages and features unrelated to the requested scope (e.g., detailed Cookie Policy page, DeploymentInfo page, extensive dashboard/analytics/transactions feature enhancements).
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest focuses on quiz dataset expansion, cookie consent popup, sidebar violet styling, compare/contact updates, and favicon redesign. The diff summary file indicates broader feature/page additions/overhauls beyond those requests.

hallucinated_features.description: Cookie consent banner includes additional UI/actions beyond the requirement (e.g., Learn More button, links to /cookie-policy and /privacy-policy, X icon that triggers accept).
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-3 only asks for an Accept button and persistence/dismissal behavior. The implementation introduces extra navigation and treats the close (X) as acceptance, which was not requested.
